dt: {bc}an action or device designed to negate or offset another

dt.t: The most well-known {wi}countermeasure{/wi} by a physician is a malicious-persecution suit against the lawyer who sued him and failed to prove a case.
The Germans had developed a tricky magnetic mine, but the British had developed a {wi}countermeasure{/wi} for this even before the mine was used.

aq.auth: Bernard Brodie and Fawn M. Brodie

shortdef: an action or device designed to negate or offset another; especially : electronic countermeasure

dt: {bc}the disruption of the operation of an enemy's equipment (as by jamming radio or radar signals)
{bc}the equipment used to produce the disruption

shortdef: the disruption of the operation of an enemy's equipment (as by jamming radio or radar signals); also : the equipment used to produce the disruption

dt: {bc}an action or device designed to negate or offset a {d_link|countermeasure|countermeasure}
{bc}a military system or device intended to block a sensing mechanism (such as a radar detector) that was intended to counteract another sensing mechanism (such as radar)

dt.t: They have made a massive investment in electronic {wi}counter-countermeasures{/wi}, as well as lethal and non-lethal countermeasures.

shortdef: an action or device designed to negate or offset a countermeasure; especially : a military system or device intended to block a sensing mechanism (such as a radar detector) that was intended to counteract another sensing mechanism (such as radar)
